client
Interface ICommManager

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
ClientRMICommManager
public interface ICommManager
extends java.rmi.Remote

An RMI Communication Manager Interface that serves as a means of relaying messages between the server and the client. Implementations may connect with a controller, or handle the messages in some other way.

Author:
Marc

Method Summary
 boolean connect()
          Connects the CommManager to the server.
 void receiveVersion(java.lang.String version)
          Called by server after client calls requestVersion to handle the return of the request.
 void registerController(IController controller)
          Adds the controller as a listener to the CommManager.
 void requestVersion(ICommManager callback)
          Requests the version of the application from the server.
 void unregisterController(IController controller)
          Removes the controller as a listener to the CommManager.
 

Method Detail

requestVersion

void requestVersion(ICommManager callback)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Requests the version of the application from the server. The server will return by calling receiveVersion on callback.

Parameters:
callback - The CommManager that will handle the callback receiveVersion
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

receiveVersion

void receiveVersion(java.lang.String version)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Called by server after client calls requestVersion to handle the return of the request.

Parameters:
version - The current version of the application
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

registerController

void registerController(IController controller)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Adds the controller as a listener to the CommManager.

Parameters:
controller - The controller to begin listening for messages
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

unregisterController

void unregisterController(IController controller)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Removes the controller as a listener to the CommManager.

Parameters:
controller - The controller to be removed from the listening array
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

connect

boolean connect()
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Connects the CommManager to the server.

Returns:
true if the connection succeeded
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
